alert.note: Alert for Coastal Bay; Coastal Gulf; South Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued March 05 at 4:58AM EST until March 08 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Walton, Bay, and Gulf County Beaches. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The rip current risk will increase to high by this evening and is expected to remain there through at least Monday evening. Despite the nice warm weather and surf of only 2 to 3 feet, strong and frequent rip currents are expected to be dangerous for all levels of swimmers, especially those who are unaware of the dangers rip currents pose.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Bay; Coastal Gulf; South Walton
